block.p: HUFFY CORP., Miamisburg, Ohio, a sporting goods company, said it would sell a division, Washington Inventory Service, San Diego, which provides inventory and information-gathering services, to a group led by Sterling Investment Partners L.P., Westport, Conn., for $84.75 million.

DELPHI AUTOMOTIVE SYSTEMS CORP., Troy, Mich., the largest auto parts maker in the world, said it had agreed to supply electrical wiring for more than 40,000 trucks of Volvo A.B. of Sweden to be built in Europe. Financial terms were not disclosed.

TRIBUNE CO., Chicago, the third-biggest newspaper publisher in the United States and owner of several television stations, agreed to sell its AchieveGlobal training unit to the closely held Institute for International Research, Monaco, for an undisclosed price.
ABC-NACO INC., Downers Grove, Ill., a manufacturer of railroad products, said it would close a factory in Melrose Park, Ill., and expedite a plan to cut 1,200 jobs to save money.
